title: (Re) writing the Nation: Re-mapping the Late Nineteeth-Century Italian Novel
abstractText: This project explores the reception and modes of representation of gothic and fantastic motifs, narrative structures, and discursive practices, particularly as developed in the Northern European tradition, in Italian pros fiction of the late nineteenth century (1861-1904, the critical period on the information of the none-state. Drawing on theoretical work on post-colonialism, on the novel, and on reception theory, this study will analyse how the Gothic and the fantastic affected the thematic for formal structure of the post-unification novel. It will thus develop understanding of the ideological and literary discourses articulated in and by the late nineteenth-century Italian novel.
